result.execSummary:
The defendant Seda M Sarlioglu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Mega Media Xchange to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

No Contact with any co-actor, victim or witness listed in the criminal complaint. Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Obtain all prescriptions through one source. Inform any treating medical personnel of this case. Maintain/work toward employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME. Commencing forthwith. May transfer to Milwaukee County. NO Electronic Monitoring Allowed.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Rumpf advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Seda M Sarlioglu in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 and case #16CF1576 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   	***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, CONCURRENT TO 14CF1515*** 

__4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 60 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS			***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY***	***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, CONCURRENT TO 14CF1515*** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 			

____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
Prescribed;
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases;
____Obtain all prescriptions through one source;
____Inform any treating medical personnel of case
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain/work toward employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:any co-actor, victim, or witness listed in the criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $215.00 Mega Media Xchange (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 120 days jail, STRAIGHT TIME. Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County (No electronic monitoring allowed). Commencing forthwith. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.
